description: These tasty treats pack in a sweet (healthy!) surprise â€” they're made with tons of super nutritious ingredients, like chia seeds.
ingredients: [{"name": "almond butter", "units": "cup", "amount": "1/2"}, {"name": "pure maple syrup", "units": "cup", "amount": "1/4"}, {"name": "chia seeds", "units": "Tbsp.", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "pure vanilla extract", "units": "tsp.", "amount": "1/2"}, {"name": "Kosher salt", "units": null, "amount": null}, {"name": "old-fashioned oats, toasted", "units": "cup", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "bittersweet chocolate chips", "units": "cup", "amount": "1/2"}]
instructions: Step 1: In medium bowl, stir together almond butter, maple syrup, chia seeds, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt; fold in oats, then chocolate chips. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Step 2: Shape mixture into 1-inch balls (about 1 heaping Tbsp each). Store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks or freeze for up to 3 months.
